metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Game Controllers
Push the buttons to move the red square:
content.html: Push the buttons to move the red square:

content.text: Get in Control
Now we want to control the red square.
content.html: Now we want to control the red square.

content.text: Add four buttons, up, down, left, and right.
content.html: Add four buttons, up, down, left, and right.

content.text: Write a function for each button to move the component in the selected direction.
content.html: Write a function for each button to move the component in the selected direction.

content.text: Make two new properties in the component constructor, and call them speedX and speedY . These properties are being used as speed indicators.
content.html: Make two new properties in the component constructor, and call them speedX and speedY. These properties are being used as speed indicators.

content.text: Add a function in the component constructor, called newPos() , which uses the speedX and speedY properties to change the component's position.
content.html: Add a function in the component constructor, called newPos(), which uses the speedX and speedY properties to change the component's position.

content.text: The newpos function is called from the updateGameArea function before drawing the component:
content.html: The newpos function is called from the updateGameArea function before drawing the component:

content.code_html:
<script>
function component(width, height, color, x, y) {
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.speedX = 0;
  this.speedY = 0;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    ctx.fillStyle = color;
    ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
  }
  this.newPos = function() {
    this.x += this.speedX;
    this.y += this.speedY;
  }
}

function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myGamePiece.newPos();
  myGamePiece.update();
}

function moveup() {
  myGamePiece.speedY -= 1;
}

function movedown() {
  myGamePiece.speedY += 1;
}

function moveleft() {
  myGamePiece.speedX -= 1;
}

function moveright() {
  myGamePiece.speedX += 1;
}
</script>

<button onclick="moveup()">UP</button>
<button onclick="movedown()">DOWN</button>
<button onclick="moveleft()">LEFT</button>
<button onclick="moveright()">RIGHT</button>

content.text: Stop Moving
If you want, you can make the red square stop when you release a button.
content.html: If you want, you can make the red square stop when you release a button.

content.text: Add a function that will set the speed indicators to 0.
content.html: Add a function that will set the speed indicators to 0.

content.text: To deal with both normal screens and touch screens, we will add code for both devices:
content.html: To deal with both normal screens and touch screens, we will add code for both devices:

content.code_html:
function stopMove() {
  myGamePiece.speedX = 0;
  myGamePiece.speedY = 0;
}
</script>

<button onmousedown="moveup()" onmouseup="stopMove()" ontouchstart="moveup()">UP</button>
<button onmousedown="movedown()" onmouseup="stopMove()" ontouchstart="movedown()">DOWN</button>
<button onmousedown="moveleft()" onmouseup="stopMove()" ontouchstart="moveleft()">LEFT</button>
<button onmousedown="moveright()" onmouseup="stopMove()" ontouchstart="moveright()">RIGHT</button>

content.text: Keyboard as Controller
We can also control the red square by using the arrow keys on the keyboard.
content.html: We can also control the red square by using the arrow keys on the keyboard.

content.text: Create a method that checks if a key is pressed, and set the key property of the myGameArea object to the key code. When the key is released, set the key property to false :
content.html: Create a method that checks if a key is pressed, and set the key property of the myGameArea object to the key code. When the key is released, set the key property to false:

content.code_html:
var myGameArea = {
  canvas : document.createElement("canvas"),
  start : function() {
    this.canvas.width = 480;
    this.canvas.height = 270;
    this.context = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
    document.body.insertBefore(this.canvas, document.body.childNodes[0]);
    this.interval = setInterval(updateGameArea, 20);
    window.addEventListener('keydown', function (e) {
      myGameArea.key = e.keyCode;
    })
    window.addEventListener('keyup', function (e) {
      myGameArea.key = false;
    })
  },
  clear : function(){
    this.context.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);
  }
}

content.text: Then we can move the red square if one of the arrow keys are pressed:
content.html: Then we can move the red square if one of the arrow keys are pressed:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myGamePiece.speedX = 0;
  myGamePiece.speedY = 0;
  if (myGameArea.key && myGameArea.key == 37) {myGamePiece.speedX = -1; }
  if (myGameArea.key && myGameArea.key == 39) {myGamePiece.speedX = 1; }
  if (myGameArea.key && myGameArea.key == 38) {myGamePiece.speedY = -1; }
  if (myGameArea.key && myGameArea.key == 40) {myGamePiece.speedY = 1; }
  myGamePiece.newPos();
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Multiple Keys Pressed
What if more than one key is pressed at the same time?
content.html: What if more than one key is pressed at the same time?

content.text: In the example above, the component can only move horizontally or vertically. Now we want the component to also move diagonally.
content.html: In the example above, the component can only move horizontally or vertically. Now we want the component to also move diagonally.

content.text: Create a keys array for the myGameArea object, and insert one element for each key that is pressed, and give it the value true , the value remains true untill the key is no longer pressed, the value becomes false in the keyup event listener function:
content.html: Create a keys array for the myGameArea object, and insert one element for each key that is pressed, and give it the value true , the value remains true untill the key is no longer pressed, the value becomes false in the keyup event listener function:

content.code_html:
var myGameArea = {
  canvas : document.createElement("canvas"),
  start : function() {
    this.canvas.width = 480;
    this.canvas.height = 270;
    this.context = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
    document.body.insertBefore(this.canvas, document.body.childNodes[0]);
    this.interval = setInterval(updateGameArea, 20);
    window.addEventListener('keydown', function (e) {
      myGameArea.keys = (myGameArea.keys || []);
      myGameArea.keys[e.keyCode] = true;
    })
    window.addEventListener('keyup', function (e) {
      myGameArea.keys[e.keyCode] = false;
    })
  },
  clear : function(){
    this.context.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);
  }
}

 function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myGamePiece.speedX = 0;
  myGamePiece.speedY = 0;
  if (myGameArea.keys && myGameArea.keys[37]) {myGamePiece.speedX = -1; }
  if (myGameArea.keys && myGameArea.keys[39]) {myGamePiece.speedX = 1; }
  if (myGameArea.keys && myGameArea.keys[38]) {myGamePiece.speedY = -1; }
  if (myGameArea.keys && myGameArea.keys[40]) {myGamePiece.speedY = 1; }
  myGamePiece.newPos();
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Using The Mouse Cursor as a Controller
If you want to control the red square by using the mouse cursor, add a method in myGameArea object that updates the x and y coordinates of the mouse cursor:.
content.html: If you want to control the red square by using the mouse cursor, add a method in myGameArea object that updates the x and y coordinates of the mouse cursor:.

content.code_html:
var myGameArea = {
  canvas : document.createElement("canvas"),
  start : function() {
    this.canvas.width = 480;
    this.canvas.height = 270;
    this.canvas.style.cursor = "none"; //hide the original cursor
    this.context = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
    document.body.insertBefore(this.canvas, document.body.childNodes[0]);
    this.interval = setInterval(updateGameArea, 20);
    window.addEventListener('mousemove', function (e) {
      myGameArea.x = e.pageX;
      myGameArea.y = e.pageY;
    })
  },
  clear : function(){
    this.context.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);
  }
}

content.text: Then we can move the red square using the mouse cursor:
content.html: Then we can move the red square using the mouse cursor:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  if (myGameArea.x && myGameArea.y) {
    myGamePiece.x = myGameArea.x;
    myGamePiece.y = myGameArea.y;
  }
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Touch The Screen to Control The Game
We can also control the red square on a touch screen.
content.html: We can also control the red square on a touch screen.

content.text: Add a method in the myGameArea object that uses the x and y coordinates of where the screen is touched:
content.html: Add a method in the myGameArea object that uses the x and y coordinates of where the screen is touched:

content.code_html:
var myGameArea = {
  canvas : document.createElement("canvas"),
  start : function() {
    this.canvas.width = 480;
    this.canvas.height = 270;
    this.context = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
    document.body.insertBefore(this.canvas, document.body.childNodes[0]);
    this.interval = setInterval(updateGameArea, 20);
    window.addEventListener('touchmove', function (e) {
      myGameArea.x = e.touches[0].screenX;
      myGameArea.y = e.touches[0].screenY;
    })
  },
  clear : function(){
    this.context.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);
  }
}

content.text: Then we can move the red square if the user touches the screen, by using the same code as we did for the mouse cursor:
content.html: Then we can move the red square if the user touches the screen, by using the same code as we did for the mouse cursor:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  if (myGameArea.x && myGameArea.y) {
    myGamePiece.x = myGameArea.x;
    myGamePiece.y = myGameArea.y;
  }
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Controllers on The Canvas
We can also draw our own buttons on the canvas, and use them as controllers:
content.html: We can also draw our own buttons on the canvas, and use them as controllers:

syntaxHighlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);  myUpBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 10);   myDownBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 70);   myLeftBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 20, 40);   myRightBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 80, 40);   myGameArea.start();}

content.code: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);  myUpBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 10);   myDownBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 70);   myLeftBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 20, 40);   myRightBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 80, 40);   myGameArea.start();}

syntax_highlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);  myUpBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 10);   myDownBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 70);   myLeftBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 20, 40);   myRightBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 80, 40);   myGameArea.start();}

content.code_html:
function startGame() {
  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);
  myUpBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 10);
  myDownBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 70);
  myLeftBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 20, 40);
  myRightBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 80, 40);
  myGameArea.start();
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);  myUpBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 10);   myDownBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 50, 70);   myLeftBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 20, 40);   myRightBtn = new component(30, 30, "blue", 80, 40);   myGameArea.start();}

content.text: Add a new function that figures out if a component, in this case a button, is clicked.
content.html: Add a new function that figures out if a component, in this case a button, is clicked.

content.text: Start by adding event listeners to check if a mouse button is clicked ( mousedown and mouseup ). To deal with touch screens, also add event listeners to check if the screen is clicked on ( touchstart and touchend ):
content.html: Start by adding event listeners to check if a mouse button is clicked (mousedown and mouseup). To deal with touch screens, also add event listeners to check if the screen is clicked on (touchstart and touchend):

content.code_html:
var myGameArea = {
  canvas : document.createElement("canvas"),
  start : function() {
    this.canvas.width = 480;
    this.canvas.height = 270;
    this.context = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
    document.body.insertBefore(this.canvas, document.body.childNodes[0]);
    this.interval = setInterval(updateGameArea, 20);
    window.addEventListener('mousedown', function (e) {
      myGameArea.x = e.pageX;
      myGameArea.y = e.pageY;
    })
    window.addEventListener('mouseup', function (e) {
      myGameArea.x = false;
      myGameArea.y = false;
    })
    window.addEventListener('touchstart', function (e) {
      myGameArea.x = e.pageX;
      myGameArea.y = e.pageY;
    })
    window.addEventListener('touchend', function (e) {
      myGameArea.x = false;
      myGameArea.y = false;
    })
  },
  clear : function(){
    this.context.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);
  }
}

content.text: Now the myGameArea object has properties that tells us the x- and y-coordinates of a click. We use these properties to check if the click was performed on one of our blue buttons.
content.html: Now the myGameArea object has properties that tells us the x- and y-coordinates of a click. We use these properties to check if the click was performed on one of our blue buttons.

content.text: The new method is called clicked , it is a method of the component constructor, and it checks if the component is being clicked.
content.html: The new method is called clicked, it is a method of the component constructor, and it checks if the component is being clicked.

content.text: In the updateGameArea function, we take the neccessarry actions if one of the blue buttons is clicked:
content.html: In the updateGameArea function, we take the neccessarry actions if one of the blue buttons is clicked:

content.code_html:
function component(width, height, color, x, y) {
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.speedX = 0;
  this.speedY = 0;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    ctx.fillStyle = color;
    ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
  }
  this.clicked = function() {
    var myleft = this.x;
    var myright = this.x + (this.width);
    var mytop = this.y;
    var mybottom = this.y + (this.height);
    var clicked = true;
    if ((mybottom < myGameArea.y) || (mytop > myGameArea.y) || (myright < myGameArea.x) || (myleft > myGameArea.x)) {
      clicked = false;
    }
    return clicked;
  }
}

function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  if (myGameArea.x && myGameArea.y) {
    if (myUpBtn.clicked()) {
      myGamePiece.y -= 1;
    }
    if (myDownBtn.clicked()) {
      myGamePiece.y += 1;
    }
    if (myLeftBtn.clicked()) {
      myGamePiece.x += -1;
    }
    if (myRightBtn.clicked()) {
      myGamePiece.x += 1;
    }
  }
  myUpBtn.update();
  myDownBtn.update();
  myLeftBtn.update();
  myRightBtn.update();
  myGamePiece.update();
}
